The Kissing Hand is an American children's picture book written by Audrey Penn and illustrated by Ruth E. Harper and Nancy M. Leak. It features a mother raccoon comforting a child raccoon by kissing its paw. It was first published by the Child Welfare League of America in 1993, it has been used to reassure children upset by separation anxiety.

This weeks #FacultyFriday is Megan Opitz.
Mrs. Opitz graduated from Arizona State University with a BA in elementary education. After teaching in the Tempe School District, she followed took a break and followed another passion of cooking. In 2011, they returned to Phoenix just in time to help open Archway Veritas. She loved teaching the first seven years in KA and is now the Assistant Headmaster. She has two sweet babes that can’t wait to be Archway Veritas Patriots! Mrs. Opitz still loves to cook, bake, spend time with family, learn, and practice Brazilian Jiu Jitsu.

CONGRATULATIONS 5th graders!!! Even in these unique times, we want to celebrate your time at Archway Veritas and wish you the best for next year, wherever you may go. On Wednesday, May 20th at 7:00 p.m. prompt we will host a Drive-In Graduation Night!
We understand that not everyone will able to make it. The event will be hosted on Zoom. The link will be sent on Tuesday, May 19th to all 5th grade families. We invite all 5th grade families join the Zoom event, whether on site or at home. Dr. Jeffries will begin the evening with a heartfelt farewell before Mrs. Washburn welcomes those entering 6th grade at Veritas Prep. Similar to years past, virtue awards recipients will be announced and awarded with a plaque.
In order to ensure social distancing requirements, we ask that all cars keep their driver side windows up. Dr. Jeffries will distribute the diplomas to each car through the passenger side window, preferably to the student who is to receive it. Given the anticipated temperature, formal attire is not required. However, do feel free to decorate your car!

This weeks #FacultyFriday is Mary Frances Jeffries.

Prior to joining Great Hearts, Dr. Jeffries was an Adjunct Professor with Northern Arizona University as well as an Instructional Coach in Scottsdale Unified School District. She started her teaching career as a 4th grade teacher in Northern California. She has also taught 1st, 4th/5th transition, and 6th grade.

Dr. Jeffries served as the Chairperson of the Order of Malta’s Growing the Faith program, Chair of the World Day of the Sick Mass televised on EWTN and has served as a board member of Open World Learning in Denver, Colorado. She has served in several volunteer roles as well. She was a volunteer instructor in Journalism at Valor Christian High School in Denver, Colorado and a Catechist at St. Bernard of Clairvaux in Scottsdale, Arizona.

Dr. Jeffries earned her doctoral degree in Educational Leadership from Pepperdine University. She met her husband, Tim, as a Sophomore at Santa Clara University. They have been married 31 years; have two daughters and two grandchildren.

post_text: This weeks #FacultyFriday is Stephanie Lentz. Ms.Lentz is in her fourth year as a Kindergarten teacher at Archway Veritas. She has a Master’s in Education from Arizona State University, a Master’s in Sociology from Norther Illinois University, and two Bachelor’s from ASU as well. Being the first person in her family to attend college, she loves education! She has two wonderful daughters who attend Veritas Prep in the seventh and ninth grades. She loves coffee, books, her daughters, and her students! She hopes to be at Archway for many years as a part of the Kindergarten team!

This weeks #FacultyFriday is Daniela Oliverio-Lauderdale.
This is Ms. Oliverio-Lauderdale’s first year at Archway Veritas working as an Exceptional Student Services Coordinator. Previously, she was a third grade lead teacher at Maryvale Preparatory Academy, a title I Great Hearts school, for three years. So she has kept everything in the Great Hearts family and network although she moved schools. Ms. Oliverio-Lauderdale has her bachelor’s degree and master’s degree in Medical Anthropology and lived abroad in various countries from Ethiopia to Vancouver, Canada. She enjoys hiking, camping, yoga, and hanging out with her dog. Dogs and dog training is a passion for her although it is taking a backseat while she learns more about Special Education (SPED) this year. She is excited to serve Archway Veritas students in this new capacity utilizing her previous knowledge as a homeroom teacher from a title I school.

This weeks #FacultyFriday is Catherine Carter.
"When Veritas Prep opened in 2003, our eldest daughter Katie entered its 7th Grade. Five years later, our son Geoffrey joined her. When Teleos Prep opened in 2009, our youngest daughter Abigail was in its 3rd Grade. I began working there as the teaching assistant, and then when Archway Veritas opened in 2011, I transferred along with my daughter. As a nurse and midwife in England in the ‘80s, I never imagined teaching American and world history, and so many other subjects, to second graders in Arizona. Through this work, I have also developed a strong desire to work more with students who struggle with literacy. Now that Abigail is a senior, we are contemplating an empty nest, but I will continue to work at this very special school to help more students benefit from its rich curriculum and culture."
